entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster of Hogwarts School, mentioned as a witness and in charge of Harry Potter. He is described as calm and collected.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is the Minister of Magic, mentioned as being at odds with Dumbledore and accusing Harry Potter of misusing magic. He is described as loud and confrontational.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is the main character, mentioned as being accused by Fudge of misusing magic. He is described as defensive and trying to clear his name.

relationships.description: Fudge accuses Dumbledore of being lenient with Harry Potter, implying that Dumbledore is not taking the accusations seriously.
Fudge accuses Harry Potter of misusing magic and trying to cover it up, implying that Harry is guilty of wrongdoing.
Dumbledore defends Harry Potter against Fudge's accusations, suggesting that Harry is innocent and that the accusations are unfounded.
